NEED HELP TO RELOCATE?
If you're traveling outside Victoria for a co-op work term, you may be eligible for a limited $1,000 travel stipend through the Strategic Framework Experiential Learning Fund (SF-ELF). For details, see the section Co-operative Education Travel Awards for Work Terms outside Victoria


8 MONTH WORK TERM

Work Duration: 8 months (An 8 month employment period is registered as 2 separate, consecutive work terms). Please ONLY apply if you are available for 8 months, and state your availability CLEARLY in your cover letter.

Note For Engineering Undergraduate Students: Before applying to this posting, it is your responsibility to have completed the appropriate pre-requisite courses for this length of work term, and to understand how this length of work term affects your academics. Engineering undergrads -- If this means you will be registered in a 5th or higher work term, the full co-op tuition fee (equal to two installments) will be charged for each extra work term above the mandatory four.

Key Accountabilities:

Organizes IT Service Desk incident inquiries by creating, updating, and closing request tickets.
Performs preliminary prioritization of incidents and requests.
Acts as a primary point of contact for end-users to assist with the resolution of network, hardware, software, and other IT-related problems, as well to provide information which end-users are authorized to receive.
Acts as a primary point of contact for Tier 2 and Tier 3 support technicians when they request additional information from end-users for troubleshooting.
Provides technical support by guiding end-users through troubleshooting and correction actions via email and telephone and/or performing such actions via remote assistance/control tools or in person as required.
Responds to automated system, network and other events to proactively resolve incidents within their scope of responsibility and/or escalate them to Tier 2 and Tier 3 technicians.
Installs, configures, modifies, repairs and tests computer hardware such as workstations, printers, telephones and other peripheral equipment.
Liaises with hardware and software vendors to communicate incidents and perform actions as per their recommendations.
Performs preventative maintenance of end-user computer equipment and software.
Installs, tests, upgrades, and updates software, OS, and hardware.
Escalates unresolved incidents to Tier 2 technicians.
Participates in the development of technical support procedures within their scope of responsibility and improves the overall quality of service by providing feedback to IT management personnel.
Participates in other IT projects by providing input and recommendations from the perspective of the IT Service desk.
Performs other duties as assigned.

Knowledge of technical skills, including experience with networking, hardware, and software systems
Good communication skills (written/verbal) in English
Problem-solving and decision-making skills
Ability to manage multiple priorities and meet deadlines
Ability to work effectively in a team environment and individually
Attention to detail in following documentation, including Technician Training/Service Manuals
